intro: Stylidium saxifragoides, commonly known as the rock-stemmed sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its compact, hairy foliage and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Stylidium saxifragoides is a perennial herb that relies on specific pollinators, such as certain species of bees and flies, for reproduction.
